Explore Ghana's treasures

From wildlife-rich savannah to historic coastal fortresses, discorver the destinations that make Ghana unforgettable.

Mole National Park

Ghana's Premier Wildlife Safari Destination

Experience the thrill of encountering elephants, antelopes, and over 300 bird species in their natural habitat. Mole offers unforgettable safari adventures across 4,840 square kilometers of pristine savanna.

Highlights

Elephant Safari
Bird Watching
Canopy Walkways
Museum Experience
2-3 days
Best: Nov - Apr
Learn More

Larabanga Mosque

West Africa's Oldest Mosque

Step back in time at this stunning 15th-century mosque, built in the traditional Sudanese architectural style. The Larabanga Mosque stands as a testament to Ghana's Islamic heritage and timeless beauty.

Highlights

Ancient Architecture
Sacred Mystic Stone
Local Guide
Half day
Best: Year-round
Learn More

Salaga Slave Wells

A Journey Through History

Discover the poignant history of the trans-Saharan slave trade at these historic wells. Salaga was once a major trading post, and these wells and shrines tell powerful stories of Ghana's past.

Highlights

Historical Tours
Cultural Education
Heritage Sites
Local Stories
1 day
Best: Year-round
Learn More

Cape Coast Castle

Where History Echoes

Walk through the powerful corridors of Cape Coast Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that stands as a sobering reminder of the Atlantic slave trade. This fortress offers profound insights into Ghana's complex colonial past.

Highlights

Historical Tours
Ocean Views
Museum Exhibits
1 day
Best: Year-round
Learn More
